entry.title: Yellow Paper Daisy
entry.summary:
Author: Babysterek

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 31,843Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 75

Summary: ‚ÄúWell,‚Äù Peter says at last, forcing a crooked smile into his voice, ‚Äúat least this time he didn‚Äôt almost get us all killed.‚ÄùDerek swallows. His throat is dry, the words scraping on the way out. ‚ÄúI was drunk.‚Äù They land and disappear without effect. Talia turns then, her gaze settling on him fully. It‚Äôs steady, unreadable, and it makes his shoulders tense despite himself. ‚ÄúYou were careless,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúYou are a werewolf, and if you got drunk, you laced it with wolfsbane, you did it. Do you understand, In twenty-four years, every scandal has had the same root. You. At some point, it stops being bad luck and becomes character. And I am tired of pretending this is something that merely happens to you.‚Äù --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Derek just wanted a moment of quiet. Instead, he crosses a line with the last person he should trust.....old grudges, bad decisions and a mistake he keeps repeating. "He learned the shape of the poison once, from a woman who wore it like skin. Now hemlock blooms in his own hands, and he cannot tell where she ends and he begins. "

entry.title: BLOODLINE PROTOCOL
entry.summary:
Author: knox_rivers

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 161,493Chapters: 47/?Kudos: 184

Summary: At Beacon Hills Preparatory, tradition is everything. For over a century, the elite boarding school has divided its student body into five historic houses where each one seemingly determined by a mix of academic performance, behavior, and an unspoken layer of socioeconomic legacy. Most students follow in the footsteps of their families; generation after generation they're sorted into the same houses. No one questions the system. It‚Äôs simply the way things are. Until now. Midway through his freshman year, a ‚Äúroutine‚Äù blood test for school health records takes an unexpected turn. One sharp-witted yet grounded Stiles, recently appointed as House Prefect of the mid-tier House Flagstaff largely due to his father‚Äôs position as the town sheriff, is abruptly reassigned to House Redwood, the school‚Äôs most elite and secretive house. He must now navigate secret traditions, political manipulation, and a slow-burning forbidden romance with someone he was never meant to meet: the enigmatic sophomore son of a ruthless defense attorney.

entry.title: No One Is That Perfect!
entry.summary:
Author: StarStruckFears

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,829Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 15

Summary: Stiles Stilinski is absolutely, undeniably convinced that Derek Hale is a demon. Because no one looks that good, moves that smooth, or survives holy water, salt circles, crucifixes, smoke tests, and a questionable amount stalking without being at least a little supernatural. Armed with a water gun, a Moonlet, and dangerously flawed logic, Stiles is determined to expose the truth ‚Äî even if it kills him. (Unfortunately for Stiles, the only thing he actually succeeds in uncovering is Derek‚Äôs awareness‚Ä¶ and interest.)

entry.title: They May Have Fallen But We Still Stand
entry.summary:
Author: Effra

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 76,231Chapters: 10/18Kudos: 138

Summary: Lieutenant Stiles Stilinski of the Nemetan rifle regiment can't find it in his heart to celebrate the end of the long and bloody war against the darachs. Perhaps it‚Äôs the faces that swim behind his eyelids, lost to time, dark magic and musket balls, or perhaps it‚Äôs the doubt he harbours that he can truly be good at anything except being a soldier. Regardless, as he huddles at one end of the bar, nursing an ale barely worthy of the name, he listens as the locals sing their songs and toast to the fallen. He doesn't think about the men he has lost, and he definitely doesn't think about alpha Lord Hale, leader of the Triskellan battle-pack, who was last seen leaping into the heart of the fighting with typical reckless heroism. Even if Hale had survived the battle, nothing could or would ever happen between them. Shifters were too different from humans - too wild, too strange. It didn't matter that Stiles felt like the only person who could see past the teeth and claws to the heart of the man beneath them. They were from two different worlds.

entry.title: Loving Isaac
entry.summary:
Author: QueenOfAngst21

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 56,190Chapters: 20/20Kudos: 2,991

Summary: A regular patrol around their land takes a turn for the worse when Derek and Isaac run into a unwanted visitor. Just when Derek thinks they are in the clear, he wakes to find not his beta beside him but a crying blonde haired baby right where he left Isaac. The pack stumbles over themselves as their alpha and emissary navigate this new dynamic and find each other along the way.***AKA Isaac is de-aged, Derek and Stiles try to reverse the change but they find something better along the way***Set after Season 2, not in canon with the showTranslations must have permission first
